---
layout:         post-mbed-org
title:          "mbed talks to Android via ADK Open Accessory API!"
date:           2011-05-29T08:21:29.000Z
author:         Simon Ford
tags:           
originalUrl:    https://developer.mbed.org/blog/entry/mbed-talks-to-Android-via-ADK-Open-Acces/
---

<p>Google announced that Android 3.1 added &quot;Android Open Accessory&quot;
  support and the ADK, allowing external USB hardware to interact with an
  Android-powered device.</p>
<p>Because mbed has a USB Host interface built in already, that means it
  can theoretically be used to prototype Android Open Accessories. And it
  looks like some of you are already making great progress! Check this out:</p>
<div
class="flex-video">
  <iframe width="420" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Faw_45mB5Ww"
  frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>
  </div>
  <p>This video was made by <span><span class="authortext"><a href="/users/abe00makoto/"><img alt="" class="icon" src="data:image/jpeg;base64,"></a> <a href="/users/abe00makoto/"> makoto  abe</a></span></span>and
    is found on his notebook page (currently in Japanese!)</p>
  <ul>
    <li><a href="http://mbed.org/users/abe00makoto/notebook/mbed_adk/">mbed ADK</a>

    </li>
  </ul>
  <p>Looks like there could be some interesting projects ahead!</p>
  <p>There is also a video for the Google IO session itself, where this was
    announced:</p>
  <div class="flex-video">
    <iframe width="420" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/s7szcpXf2rE"
    frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>
  </div>
  <p>For all the details, see:</p>
  <ul>
    <li><a href="http://www.google.com/events/io/2011/sessions/android-open-accessory-api-and-development-kit-adk.html"
      rel="nofollow">Google I/O session on Android Open Accessory API and Development Kit (ADK)</a>
    </li>
  </ul>
